What I am suggesting is that SQUAD (or the commnity) makes an app for mobile devices like an iPad where you can open it, sync up with your game and you get a navball, action group buttons, RCS, SAS, gear, brake and light switches and maybe staging all on one touchscreen screen!

I saw som guy make that but he was too greedy to put it up on the AppStore.
And the purpose of this is... what?
Clears some of the clutter off your screen and gives you a bit more of a spacial experience.
I like this idea, gives the player a bit of that, "mission control" feel having a monitor for the navball etc.

I can actually see the use of this, I'll probably only use it once and then go back to normal, but then a few months later do the same thing.

only problem would be connection speed, would it be over your network? or use bluetooth,

I ask this because my mum is an avid Farmvlle player (and we all know how much of a bandwidth hog Fv is) so if i did use the app, I wouldn't really like having my navball lag behind what's happening on screen.

Bluetooth provides a more stable connection though could burn your battery.

WiFi can be a bit difficult for the average person to set up though, but you can transfer much bigger data packets than through Bluetooth, because as far as I know bluetooth is good for streaming music, game info-unknown.

You could kinda use a smart device to go onto webpages Telemachus puts up?

But I get what you mean, some form of app that had your flight info on it, would be pretty sweet Get a few devices up around to make mission control, a freed up screen maybe even like action groups (With descriptions) on it, among other things, but someone would have to do it

I really don't know if this would be likely or unlikely for SQUAD to do, as it could actually lend itself to KSP working in more open areas/schools and maybe for whatever KSPedu will be, it's also a random software/hardware pair up that seems like a bit of a stretch to do at this stage of the game but then, 3D mouse functionality has been added and I didn't see that coming, plus "Smart Glass" type things seem to be popping up everywhere.

You could kinda use a smart device to go onto webpages Telemachus puts up?

Yeah, I think telemachus gives a lot of the "Mission control" feel, but it's all output. I don't think it provides anyway to give input/control. But you could use it to track Altitude & resources.

I don't think it provides anyway to give input/control. But you could use it to track Altitude & resources.

You can use Telemachus to adjust the throttle, toggle SAS, fire action groups and control some of Smart ASS.
